original_theorem:
If $\{F_n\}$ converges uniformly to $F$ on $S$ and each $F_n$ is
continuous at a point $x_0$ in $S,$ then so is $F$. Similar
statements hold for continuity from the right and left$.$
theorem_translation:
```lean4
theorem uniform_convergence_preserves_continuity {Î± Î² : Type*} [TopologicalSpace Î±] [MetricSpace Î²]
    {F : â„• â†’ Î± â†’ Î²} {f : Î± â†’ Î²} {s : Set Î±} {xâ‚€ : Î±}
    (h_unif : TendstoUniformlyOn F f atTop s)
    (h_cont_fn : âˆ€ n, ContinuousAt (F n) xâ‚€) :
    ContinuousAt f xâ‚€ := by
```

attempt_history.verified_code:
import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem uniform_convergence_preserves_continuity {Î± Î² : Type*} [TopologicalSpace Î±] [MetricSpace Î²]
    {F : â„• â†’ Î± â†’ Î²} {f : Î± â†’ Î²} {s : Set Î±} {xâ‚€ : Î±}
    (h_unif : TendstoUniformlyOn F f atTop s)
    (h_cont_fn : âˆ€ n, ContinuousAt (F n) xâ‚€) :
    ContinuousAt f xâ‚€ := by sorry

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
â€¢ $\{F_n\}$ is a sequence of functions from $S$ to $\mathbb{C}$, $F$ is a function from $S$ to $\mathbb{C}$ [tc_1].
â€¢ $x_0 \in S$ [tc_2].
Therefore, we conclude:
â€¢ For any $x \in S$ and any $n \in \mathbb{N}$, by the triangle inequality, $|F(x)-F(x_0)| \le |F(x)-F_n(x)| + |F_n(x)-F_n(x_0)| + |F_n(x_0)-F(x_0)|$ [l1].
proof_steps.lean_tactics:
have l1 : âˆ€ (x : Î±) (n : â„•),
      dist (f x) (f xâ‚€) â‰¤ dist (f x) (F n x) + dist (F n x) (F n xâ‚€) + dist (F n xâ‚€) (f xâ‚€) := by
    intros x n
    calc
      dist (f x) (f xâ‚€) = dist (f x) (F n x) + dist (F n x) (F n xâ‚€) + dist (F n xâ‚€) (f xâ‚€) := by
        rw [dist_triangle, dist_triangle]

theorem uniform_convergence_preserves_continuity {Î± Î² : Type*} [TopologicalSpace Î±] [MetricSpace Î²]
    {F : â„• â†’ Î± â†’ Î²} {f : Î± â†’ Î²} {s : Set Î±} {xâ‚€ : Î±}
    (h_unif : TendstoUniformlyOn F f atTop s)
    (h_cont_fn : âˆ€ n, ContinuousAt (F n) xâ‚€) :
    ContinuousAt f xâ‚€ := by
have l1 : âˆ€ (x : Î±) (n : â„•),
      dist (f x) (f xâ‚€) â‰¤ dist (f x) (F n x) + dist (F n x) (F n xâ‚€) + dist (F n xâ‚€) (f xâ‚€) := by
    intros x n
    calc
      dist (f x) (f xâ‚€) = dist (f x) (F n x) + dist (F n x) (F n xâ‚€) + dist (F n xâ‚€) (f xâ‚€) := by
        rw [dist_triangle, dist_triangle]
